0;3294273535;"nrnkilt";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id85046010";"5.2";5;"Secure. Reliable. Perfect.";"We wanted a solution for managing our home radiators - and - wanted something where our data was going to be secure. All other solutions on the market are selling/using your data for something other than the core service ( eg Google’s Nest).
Tado is exceeds them all. Not only is the interface totally slick and the components reliable
column2: but it’s a German company that is governed by German data protection laws (the strictest in the world) - which means all they are doing is building and delivering the best possible product. No sketchy data collection here.

column1: We love Tado and highly recommend it!";"2018-10-12T13:15:35-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";104;"en";"POSITIVE"
1;3582091487;"anthonyz_Z";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id131901028";"5.3.7";4;"Works well
column2: most of the time.";"Scheduling function works perfectly.

column1: Home/away mode. Away mode works fine. Home mode hit and miss. Sometime it doesn't register I am home and doesn't start home mode automatically
column2: but only after launching app which was in background. Otherwise it will start home mode only after I have walk through the door which is also when I connect to my home wifi and tado knows I am home positively. Seldom I will come home with the Aircon temp already set nicely. For the above I have set my home geo fence to the smallest radius which they did warned will not be reliable. I have increased the radius and will update back here again.

column1: Could give better control over the function that automatically turns off the Aircon when a set temperature is hit. Currently I can only set a single range +/- same temp ie 2deg lower it will cut off
column2: 2 deg warmer it will turn back on. Unable to control individual colder or warmer timer preference too for this case it's same.";"2018-12-27T19:31:19-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";173;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 2;3548411821;"Nai-De";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id39059509";"5.3.5";4;"Charging for a product support app?";"Subscription apps are unacceptable
column2: particularly in the case of hardware support apps that switch to subscription pricing after a substantial hardware investment was made.

column1: Obviously the developer had a change of heart to switch from subscription pricing to one-time upgrade fee (at least for legacy customers
column2: don’t know how it is for new customers)

column1: That makes a huge difference. Updating my rating from one to four stars correspondingly.
I’m glad this was changed!
Original Review
The whole point of buying their devices was maximal energy savings
column2: of which the software is an integral part.

column1: That now
column2: after people have spent lots of money to buy into their system
column3: they start to charge monthly fees to use something we already bought

column1: Imagine this sets an example: you convert your home to hue lighting
column2: then Philips starts to charge a subscription fee for the app.

column1: Apple sells you an iPhone
column2: then starts charging a monthly fee for using iOS.

column1: You buy a sofa
column2: a year later the carpenter stops by and installs a meter that charges you a cent each time you sit down.

column1: If you add some serious functionality
column2: charge for the upgrade
column3: letting me choose if I need the features or not. But stop beings leeches who think they deserve an income stream for perpetuity for work done and paid to employees one time only.";"2018-12-19T05:16:02-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";229;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 3;3542294352;"Sir Bigglesworth";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id100523653";"5.3.5";2;"Can’t Add/Assign Rooms";"This product has a lot of potential and I’d like to increase my rating later but right now I’m too frustrated.

Had to wait for custom instructions for installation because my existing thermostat and heating configuration wasn’t pre-loaded into Tado’s automated installation instructions program.  When I did finally get the instructions via email it caused my separately-controlled in-floor heating in my kitchen (operating off the same boiler and boiler controller as all the room thermostats) to stop working - at least the radiators kept working.
To top it all off
column2: I also cannot create and assign individual room names to each of my radiator thermostats which prevents me from controlling them individually from my phone.  This was a big reason why I wanted this product!!

column1: Instead
column2: I keep getting an annoying message that says

column1: “Assignment to new room by user not possible yet.  To reassign the device to a new room please contact our Technical Support.  You can find the number for your country in our Help Center.”
This seems to be such a simple but critical update and easy problem to solve - why the heck hasn’t Tado fixed this yet!?!

I want to like this product and to increase my rating of it.  It has potential.  But I’m too frustrated right now.";"2018-12-17T12:37:05-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";214;"en";"POSITIVE"

4;5181769855;"ifeignit";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id107439759";"5.8.4";1;"Used to work but then they removed its best feature";"The Tado Smart AC Controller used to be a great piece of hardware
column2: giving the ability to manually program your air conditioner’s commands if you didn’t like the presets or your brand wasn’t available. Now you can no longer do that. Even though the device itself supports swinging
column3: the lousy preset Tado made doesn’t
column4: so I used to program it in myself. I had to factory reset due to getting a different model AC and now this feature is gone.

column1: This is what their support team had to say
“We are sorry to inform you that it is not possibile to register single commands (like swings). Unfortunately
column2: with the new software release
column3: this possibility is no more supported because it was too time consuming.  We apologize for the inconvenience.”

column1: Basically
column2: even though I was willing to go through the trouble
column3: they decided for the consumer that it wasn’t necessary. Competing IR blasters let you do manual inputs

column1: The worst part is the “Teach Tado” option is in the app and on the website still
column2: it simply doesn’t work. Essentially this is false advertising.

column1: Very
column2: very disappointed.";"2019-11-22T07:25:17-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";190;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 5;1810982890;"shimoorek";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id31927226";"4.3.1";5;"Apple Watch integration";"I’m enjoying the convenient UI of the Applications. It’s needing a refresh that includes the Apple Watch capability where if I go for a jog and leave my iPhone at home
column2: the geo-location from the Apple Watch could be added as a second device.

column1: The ability to teach the tadö AC Control to perform settings that the remote allows will also benefit this app. My Fujitsu AC unit has a humility control
column2: fan
column3: and stage change options for the vent that the app does not offer for my AC unit. Fixes for that and this app will be receiving a change in rating.";"2017-09-26T06:18:53-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";103;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 6;3096139245;"Rob (AUA-BOS)";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id6762803";"4.13";5;"Awesome Little Device";"Initial set up didn’t work
column2: but Support took care of everything for me. This device works! After power outages it works! After internet outages it works! Not like finicky Wemo products that disconnect for unknown reasons and never reconnect. I use this for the main airco unit in a second home thousands of kilometers away and it’s always there for me. It runs the ac four times a day like clock work
column3: plus allows me to override as needed if additional cooling or dehumidification is required. Love it!!";"2018-08-21T11:11:45-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";88;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 7;4267689595;"AT_AU";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id117321153";"5.6.1";5;"Very bad UI
column2: inflexible automation";"It takes way too many taps to turn the AC on and off and to change temperature. Have a look at Apple’s HomeKit interface for ACs to see this done well.

column1: Also
column2: very annoying that there is no option for a scheduled automation to override manual control function.

column1: Bad
column2: bad app.";"2019-06-05T06:42:56-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";51;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 8;3452775947;"mroach";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id35367157";"5.2.4";1;"I’m returning the whole kit";"After hours of research and days of thinking it over
column2: I settled on the tado smart thermostats. Two features that appealed to me most were open window detection and geofencing to automatically control the temperature. There is NO mention anywhere on tado’s website that you have to pay a monthly subscription fee for these features. What’s the point in getting smart thermostats to save money if I’m pouring the savings into subscription?

column1: It wouldn’t have been so bad if they actually mentioned this anywhere on their site. Not even the box says you need a subscription for this.

I’m packing these back up and returning them. I’ll probably get a Netatmo or Elgato Eve instead.";"2018-11-23T16:54:27-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";115;"en";"NEGATIVE"

9;6610414480;"Skildpadden Pede";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id242158143";"6.0.2";3;"Great app but greedy subscription model";"Charging people 3$ monthly for the implementation of geo fencing and window detection is too much and should be stated much clearer on the product when purchasing. The detection algorithm is running on the phone resulting in push messages
column2: so why not bring the final functionality to the user?

column1: Otherwise the system works reliable. Some of the basic functionality takes too many interactions/steps.";"2020-11-04T22:22:05-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";63;"en";"NEUTRAL"

column1: Today I opened the app and it showede there was an update! Nice. But Then I saw I need to pay for the new version. Serious Tado? Have a look at Sonos or Apple. 15;3612245468;"sslnn";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id109136504";"5.3.7";1;"Misleading development process";"The tado system
column2: hardware part
column3: works largely as advertised. Sure it eats batteries kind of fast but I can live with that.

column1: On the app and software side:
- where is the child lock function? Promised in development for years
- where is the multiple-homes integration? I have to keep seperate accounts for each and log in-out.
- where is the EMS integration? No news for years
- you asked for customer feedback a while ago to basically develop a NEW & PAID upgrade!?
- how exactly do you plan to offer “new features” to the legacy app? By splitting and doubling development team& costs?
If this is the beggining of some new “shaddy” strategy I will stop making long term investments in your products.
My advice: stick to roots
column2: good engineering
column3: light and practical software as an unseen accessory.";"2019-01-04T11:31:40-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";140;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 16;3682522800;"MikeCooperAVL";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id427269290";"5.3.8";3;"Good
column2: but…";"I have one Tado in my office
column3: and another in our home gym. They’re great for letting me turn on the heating or AC remotely. And the geofencing is great
column4: because it stops those rooms from heating or cooling when I’m not there.

column1: But please can we have some Siri shortcuts? I’d love to be able to tell Siri to “set the gym temperature to 65 degrees”. And I’d also love to do away with separate heating and cooling options: I just want to set a temperature and then have my Tado work it out from there.
And I’d love to have notifications
column2: so I can see when the Tado I question is nearing the setting I’ve asked for.

column1: Is any of this in the pipeline?
(Oh
column2: and for my own sanity
column3: how do you pronounce “Tado” in the first place? “Tadoo”? “Tah-Doe”? :-)";"2019-01-22T11:35:57-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";144;"en";"POSITIVE"

35;1507027728;"sltong68";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id155753672";"3.5";3;"Good. Not great yet.";"I have several split a/c units and tado seemed the ideal solution to control the units. It's a bit tedious to set up as my particular brand was not supported. But once that was done it works very well. The location sensing is a great feature and apart from a weird glitch once in a while it's pretty reliable. My only complaint is that the time setting do not seem to work. It's off by exactly 6 hours and so my set on/off times are off by the same 6 hours. Strangely enough that's the time difference between my location and Munich where I see the HQ is located.

Overall a great product and easy to use app but a few bugs to work out. Looking forward to the Siri integration.";"2016-12-22T16:24:56-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=574418486&type=Purple%20Software";"574418486";131;"en";"POSITIVE"

column2: because it doesn't work with my AC at home!

column1: and I couldn't find any instruction reseting the smartAC control
column2: but eventually I figured it out. but now I am stuck with the app not being able to remove the control
column3: so I can re-register the control with the app and with the new AC unit and address.

column1: I couldn’t logout in the app
column2: only way I found is to uninstall and reinstall the app
column3: but eventually my login still has loaded with the previous setting of the control
column4: which render me unable to setup the device I have reseted.

column1: 37;1241209247;"thedotmack";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id43087758";"2.4";1;"Inaccurate temperature setting";"The device does not set the temperature properly on my AC unit
column2: it counts up 22 degrees (I hear 22 beeps) and then it counts down 18 beeps when I set it to 60 degrees. My AC unit goes between 60 and 90 degrees Fahrenheit. It's in direct line of sight to the unit.

column1: Please
column2: please
column3: PLEEEEASE just give us an up and down control button! I don't need all the fancy energy saving options
column4: I just want simple manual control. Is your API ready? I'll program it myself ;)

column1: Also
column2: does the device have an audio sensor? Maybe it could recognize device beeps? Not sure if you guys included that in the device.
